top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Only works if it actually IS more efficient.

Generally IT works with user stories.  Users want to do X or get Y done.  They’re going to ignore any suggestions on how to get there and instead look for the safest, easiest and most efficient method.

That’s why THEY are IT: their expertise is in finding the best solution, not in following someone’s instructions who doesn’t necessarily understand all the variables at play.

Hi. I am curious what your particular IT related tasks are? IT is a very large field. It is like saying "when I need my transport needs met, saying 'efficient' will get my stuff transported faster or else the transport people just transport it the way they want". This does not really make sense since transportation is such a general term. Do you want to have parcels delivered overnight or are you hauling crude oil in a tanker? Likewise, IT comprises such diverse sub fields as installing a cartridge in a printer, to developing search algorithms for google, to training machine learning models in self driving cars, to designing robots.

As a software developer I have a few counter tips to you: 1. IT is not magic, you can actually learn how it works and this will greatly enhance the interactions you will have with "IT people" in the future. 2. "IT people" are, believe it or not,  actual human beings too. You should definitely try to have a normal conversation with them instead of manipulating them with magic words.

Good luck!
